title: [Bug]: Teams doesn't start / refuses to open window of running instance after update
body:
### Can you reproduce this bug in the website/PWA?

Not applicable

### Describe the bug

After updating teams4linux, the application doesn't start when clicking the icon. If it was still running, the application window won't open either.

### What package are you using?

deb

### Version

So far: any!

### Reproduction steps

```markdown
1. Close Teams
2. Update (maybe also happens on a fresh install -- not sure & not tested)
3. Try to open Teams

If I try to run Teams from bash, the reason for it not starting is shown:

[48366:0328/145817.029483:FATAL:setuid_sandbox_host.cc(163)] The SUID sandbox helper binary was found, but is not configured correctly. Rather than run without sandboxing I'm aborting now. You need to make sure that /opt/teams-for-linux/chrome-sandbox is owned by root and has mode 4755.

When changing the permissions everything works again. I would prefer however if I didn't have to change this myself after every update.
```

### Expected Behavior

```markdown
1. Teams opens when clicking the icon after an update
```

### Debug

```markdown

```

### Additional context

OS (in case it's specific to this OS):
Distributor ID:	Ubuntu
Description:	Ubuntu 24.04.2 LTS
Release:	24.04
